name.str: schematics for APEX Mk I suit

description: Detailed set of instructions for manually turning prototype Mk 0 suit into a Mk I. Requires digitizing the suit by inserting and insulating the governing AI module and the cables connected to holder bracers placed at joint locations. An alternative is suggested in using a molecular forge to speed up the process considerably, with instructions supplied for the process as well.

name.str: schematics for APEX Mk I suit (processing)

description: Data on producing APEX Mk I suit, currently compiling. It could be used in crafting once fully rendered.

//: these are a separate handful because the code for nanofabricator template generation is restricted to both the NANOFAB_TEMPLATE items and the `nanofab_recipes` item group

name.str: Bitter Logic tangents (APEX Mk I suit)

description: A set of tangents - logical premises - for the EULER design asssitance system. This one is labeled "suit, Mk I". The only other human-language text on all pages is the hastily-scribbled "how to turn prototype into real thing".
